April 26-30 status

Tags: mozilla, webdev, weekly updates
03 May 2010

Last week (April 26-30)

  • awesome webdev onsite

    • learned about localization, the mass of krill, and cooking indian food, among other things

  • kitsune

    • r?d use bleach to clean up sphinx results
    • r?d remove didyoumean
    • r?d htaccess fix for trailing slash in search url
    • finish up minor bugs for 2.0
    • some work on 2.1 bugs
    • started converting the staging database to UTF8 with outage page
    • remove YUI dependency from kitsune
    • add WebTrends tracking
    • investigating missing excerpts

  • tiki

    • r?d using kitsune for search on stage-new
    • verified duplicates have been renamed on prod
    • add a few locales
    • searching from tiki remembers locale
    • screencast bug
    • add WebTrends tracking

This week (May 3-7)

  • kitsune

    • pick up some of the bugs filed by James

    • push 2.0/1.5.4 with rest of SUMOdev

      • in particular: ensure UTF8 conversion of database goes well

    • team goal: handle all anonymous-access forums actions and views

I work as a web developer for Mozilla, with main focus on Django, Python, and PHP. Occasionally, I write tutorials or post other information I find interesting.

I enjoy doing freelance work for other websites, mostly non-profits. If you're interested in my services, contact me through one of the links below.
